snippet: Yahoo’s shareholders are far more excited about what the company owns — namely, 24 percent of Alibaba — than anything the company runs.
abstract: Alibaba makes $1.4 billion in profit for its fourth quarter, more than double amount it made during same period year earlier; financial data is released by Yahoo, which owns 24 percent of privately owned Chinese e-commerce company and must disclose data as part of its own quarterly reports; peek inside Alibaba offers hint of its value as company prepares to file for initial public offering on American stock exchange.

byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Yahoo’s shareholders are far more excited about what the company owns — namely, 24 percent of Alibaba — than anything the company runs.

headline.main: Yahoo Profit Is a Footnote to Alibaba’s Huge Gains
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Profit Is a Footnote to Alibaba’s Huge Gains
